description_preview: Keep reading to uncover the life and contributions of Adil Al-Kalbani, a reciter celebrated for his remarkable talent.
biblio_en:
Sheikh Adel Al Kalbani is a Quran reciter from Saudi Arabia. He is also a popular and impressive preacher who has a strong presence in the media beside the active involvement in the social work and volunteerism. He was born in the city of Riyadh in 1959- 1378 and his rise was ordinary far away from attention of Quran and sharia; he said about his childhood  that he  spent it keen on Storyboards, songs and music and he wasn't keep on prayer .
Sheikh Adel's interest in Quran started by coincidence after hearing Voice of sheikh El-Menshawy reading Ayat talking about the death on radio. He started from this time memorizing Quran and attending Quran lessons at mosques.
Sheikh Adel learned at Riyadh till secondary school and he didn't have any university degree, He preferred learning Islamic sharia from famous sheikhs instead of studying at university. His plan has fully succeeded as he completed memorization of Quran and he learned the ten recitations perfectly so his reputation spread throughout the kingdom as a reader of good voice and impressive preacher.
Sheikh Adel Al Kalbani worked as an imam in a number of mosques in the city of Riyadh one of them was King Khalid mosque where he took its Imamat and prayer for 25 years.
In 1429 / 2008 royal decree was issued appointing Sheikh Adel Al Kalbani as imam of Al Masjid Al Haram (The holy mosque of Mecca) where he led Tarawih prayer in the month of Ramadan. He had been exempt from that position after a short period because of the statements of sheikh and his controversial opinions. He works now As Imam of Muhayssin mosque in Riyadh.

biblio_ar:
الشيخ عادل الكلباني من قراء القرءان الكريم في المملكة العربية السعودية، و هو كذلك إمام و خطيب مشهور و داعية مؤثر له حضور قوى في وسائل الإعلام بجانب مشاركته الفعالة في العمل الاجتماعي و التطوعي.
الشيخ عادل الكلباني ولد في مدينة الرياض عام 1959 / 1378 ، و كانت نشأة الشيخ الكلباني على غير العادة نشأة عادية بعيدة نوعاً ما عن الاهتمام بالقرءان و الأمور الشرعية، فقد قضى الشيخ طفولته في التعليم الأساسي شغوفاً بالقصص المصورة و محباً للأغانى و الموسيقى و لم يكن يداوم على الصلاة كما يحكي عن نفسه.
بدأ الشيخ اهتمامه بالقرءان و العلوم الشرعية مصادفة إثر سماعه بضعة آيات تتحدث عن الموت من إذاعة الراديو بصوت الشيخ المنشاوي، و بدأ من تلك الحادثة حفظ القرءان و إتقان تلاوته و المداومة على حضور الدروس في المساجد.
الشيخ عادل الكلباني تعلم في مدارس الرياض حتى المرحلة الثانوية، و لم يلتحق بأي جامعة أو يتحصل على شهادة جامعية، و قد آثر الشيخ تعلم القرءان و العلوم الشرعية في المساجد من المشايخ المشهورين بدلاً من الذهاب إلى الجامعة و التقيد بالمناهج الدراسية.
خطة الشيخ عادل الكلباني نجحت على أتم وجه، فقد حفظ القرءان الكريم بالقراءات العشر و ذاع صيته في أنحاء المملكة كقاريء حسن الصوت و خطيب مفوّه و داعية مؤثر. عمل الشيخ عادل الكلباني كإمام في عدد من المساجد في مدينة الرياض و منها مسجد الملك خالد الذي تولي إمامته و الصلاة و الخطابة فيه لمدة 25 عاماً.
عام 1429 / 2008 صدر مرسوم ملكي بتعيين الشيخ عادل الكلباني لإمامة المسجد الحرام و قد شارك الأئمة الآخرين في صلاة التراويح في شهر رمضان ، و قد تم إعفاء الشيخ عادل من ذلك المنصب بعد مرور فترة قصيرة بسبب تصريحات الشيخ و آراؤه المثيرة للجدل، و يعمل الشيخ عادل الكلباني الآن إماماً لجامع المحيسن بالرياض.
biblio_html_en:
Adil Al-Kalbani is a prominent figure in the Islamic world, renowned for his deep, resonant voice and his unique recitation of the Quran. Born in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in 1959, Al-Kalbani's journey from the son of poor immigrants to becoming the first Afro-Saudi Imam of the Grand Mosque in Mecca is a story of faith, perseverance, and divine favor. His appointment as an Imam at the Grand Mosque, one of the most revered positions in the Islamic faith, marked a significant milestone in his life and in the history of Islamic leadership, showcasing the inclusive nature of Islam.

The Power of Faith and Voice of Adil Al-Kalbani

Al-Kalbani's early life was humble, with his family's modest means shaping his character and work ethic. Despite the challenges, his passion for the Quran was evident from a young age. Inspired by his father, who was also a reciter, Al-Kalbani began memorizing the Quran, dedicating himself to mastering the art of Tajweed and the nuances of Quranic recitation. His relentless pursuit of excellence in recitation and his deep understanding of the Quranic teachings propelled him on a path that would eventually lead to leading prayers in one of Islam's holiest sites.

Al-Kalbani's distinctive and powerful recitation style quickly gained him recognition in Riyadh, where he led prayers in local mosques. His ability to convey the emotional depth and spiritual beauty of the Quranic verses set him apart, drawing worshippers from far and wide. However, it was his historic appointment as an Imam at the Grand Mosque in Mecca that catapulted him into the global spotlight, breaking racial barriers and highlighting the egalitarian spirit of Islam.

Adel Al Kalbani, A Symbol of Unity and Diversity

Adel Al Kalbani's appointment as an Imam was significant not only for his personal achievements but also for what it represented within the Islamic community. In a religion where equality and brotherhood are core principles, his role served as a powerful reminder of Islam's universal message. Adel Al Kalbani himself has often spoken about the importance of unity and diversity within Islam, using his platform to advocate for racial harmony and mutual respect among Muslims of different backgrounds.

Beyond his duties as an Imam, Adel Al Kalbani has made significant contributions to Islamic scholarship and community service. He has been involved in various educational initiatives, aimed at promoting a deeper understanding of the Quran and Islamic teachings. His efforts to engage with the youth and to address contemporary issues facing the Muslim community have made him a respected figure beyond the realms of recitation.

Al-Kalbani's recitations have resonated with millions around the world, with his recordings and live broadcasts becoming a staple during the holy month of Ramadan and beyond. His presence on social media and participation in international conferences have further extended his reach, allowing him to share his insights and experiences with a global audience. Through his work, Al-Kalbani has become a symbol of the rich diversity within the Islamic faith, inspiring countless individuals to embrace their identity and to contribute positively to their communities.

One of the hallmarks of Al-Kalbani's approach to his faith and leadership has been his openness to dialogue and understanding. He has advocated for critical thinking within the Muslim community, encouraging questions and discussions about faith, practice, and the challenges of modernity. This openness has endeared him to many, particularly young Muslims, who see in him a model for a reflective and engaged approach to Islam.

Al-Kalbani's commitment to the principles of Islam extends to his humanitarian work. He has been actively involved in charitable projects and initiatives aimed at alleviating poverty, providing education, and supporting healthcare in underprivileged communities.

Adil Al-Kalbani's life and work offer a powerful testament to the transformative power of faith, the beauty of Quranic recitation, and the universal values of Islam. As the first Afro-Saudi Imam of the Grand Mosque, he has broken barriers and set a precedent for inclusion and diversity within the Islamic world. His legacy is one of unity, understanding, and a deep, abiding love for the Quran that has inspired millions across the globe. In his voice, listeners find not only the spiritual depth of the Quranic verses but also a call to action – to live out the values of their faith with integrity and compassion.
